stories.title: After Hours — Lance Drill
stories.body:
The camp quiets, but your lance keeps moving. A few of the lads want to spar in the dark to keep their edge.

One bad step and someone’s bleeding. Still… good practice is hard to come by on campaign.

options.hint: Spend a little energy to build real soldiering skills.

options.text: Let them run it without you (Leadership)
options.hint: You keep your strength. They still learn from your example.

stories.title: Thin Wagons
stories.body:
The ration cart is light. No fresh sacks. No extra salt.

A couple in your lance are already talking about "finding" something before the week turns ugly.

options.text: Take a small party and forage (Scouting + Steward)
options.hint: Do it the right way. Costs time and energy, but keeps heat down.
Coin changes hands. Nobody asks too many questions.

stories.title: The Ledger and the Smile
stories.body:
The quartermaster’s clerk doesn’t look up as you approach. He just taps the ledger with a dirty nail.

"There’s the price," he says. Then, quieter: "Unless we’re friends."

options.hint: A small bribe. Lower prices today… and eyes on you tomorrow.
